meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a mycelium.
meanings.sent1: The myceloid threads spread out like tiny roots in the soil.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the myceloid growth pattern under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The myceloid texture of the cake made it look like a forest floor.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, with its myceloid curls, seemed to have a life of its own.
meanings.sent5: The myceloid design on the fabric created an interesting visual effect.

meanings.definition: Having the appearance or structure of a fungal mycelium.
meanings.sent1: The myceloid network of veins in the leaf resembled a delicate web.
meanings.sent2: The artist captured the myceloid patterns in the painting of the forest floor.
meanings.sent3: The myceloid texture of the bread made it seem like a miniature forest.
meanings.sent4: The myceloid branches of the tree intertwined like a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The myceloid growth on the log created a fascinating natural artwork.
